template:
Your help request is being actioned by {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.ServerID}}}...
```
{{#message.Help.Help}}
Welcome to the DDC2 help system. This version of DDC2 has the following command available:

       help        : Will display this dialogue
       test        : All DDC2 servers listening in a channel respond to show connectivity.
       start       : Starts DCS and supporting applications
       stop        : Stops DCS and supporting applications
       restart     : Restarts DCS and supporting applications
       status      : Returns information on the status of the server
       update      : Updates DCS and supporting applications (excluding TacView currently)
       access      : Enables Console access to the server by modifying firewall rules
       reboot      : Reboots the Operating system DDC2 and DCS reside on
       refresh     : Refreshs the configuration from the DDC2 config files
       radio       : Converts discord messages to audio and transmits them through SRS
       ports       : Displays all the ports set in the configuration files for DCS and supporting applications
       config      : Displays configuration data for the server and applications
       version     : Displays the versions of DCS and supporting applications
       info        : Displays connection information and passwords for the server
       support     : Displays support information for your server / community

Data will be displayed in a similar way as below.
#############################################
           Command : Help

       Description : Shows Help Dialogue, make sure you exclude the '!' when specifying the command you need help with.

Execution Duration : Instant, Cached Response

            Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}help
			Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}help command

         Example 1 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}help
         Example 2 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}help start
         Example 3 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}help access
#############################################
{{/message.Help.Help}}{{#message.Help.Test}}
#############################################
           Command : Test
   
       Description : Test is used to validate communications between DDC2 instances and Discord. 

Execution Duration : Instant, Cached Response
 
            Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}test
            
           Example : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}test
#############################################
{{/message.Help.Test}}{{#message.Help.Start}}
#############################################
           Command : Start
   
       Description : Start command is used to start DCS and the supporting application processes. 

Execution Duration : Approximately 90 seconds depending on your server specifications.
 
            Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}start servername
        
           Example : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}start ddc2-dev
#############################################
{{/message.Help.Start}}{{#message.Help.Stop}}
#############################################
           Command : Stop
   
       Description : Stop command is used to stop DCS and the supporting application processes. 

Execution Duration : Approximately 15 seconds depending on your server specifications.

            Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}stop servername process

         Example 1 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}stop ddc2-dev         #Stops DCS & SRS Processes (Default Action)
         Example 2 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}stop ddc2-dev -dcs    #Stops DCS Process Only
         Example 3 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}stop ddc2-dev -srs    #Stops SRS Process Only
         Example 4 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}stop ddc2-dev -game   #Stops DCS & SRS Processes
         Example 5 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}stop ddc2-dev -update #Stops DCS & SRS & LotATC Update Processes
         Example 6 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}stop ddc2-dev -all    #Stops All Game and Update Processes
#############################################
{{/message.Help.Stop}}{{#message.Help.Restart}}
#############################################
           Command : Restart
   
       Description : Restart command is used to stop and then start DCS and the supporting application processes. 

Execution Duration : Approximately 90 seconds depending on your server specifications.
 
            Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}restart servername
            
           Example : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}restart ddc2-dev
#############################################
{{/message.Help.Restart}}{{#message.Help.Status}}
#############################################
           Command : Status
   
       Description : Status command returns a message showing the current server system state, data including CPU load, RAM load, Process duration, Process health check and other details.

Execution Duration : Approximately 15 seconds depending on your server specifications.
 
            Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}status servername
            
           Example : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}status ddc2-dev
#############################################            
{{/message.Help.Status}}{{#message.Help.Update}}
#############################################
           Command : Update
   
       Description : Update command will check if their are DCS or supporting application processes running, if processes are found to be running update will not execute. This was done to stop accidental updating taking place on servers with multiple DCS instances running on them. The update command will respond every 60 seconds with an update on the progress on the updates. 

Execution Duration : Time can vary due to internet speed, etc. Responses should begin within 60 seconds.
 
             Useage: {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}update servername
            
            Example: {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}update ddc2-dev
#############################################
{{/message.Help.Update}}{{#message.Help.Access}}
#############################################
           Command : Access
   
       Description : Grants Console Access to the Server through modification of firewall rules. If no connection is achieved to the specific IP address within an allotted time the server will remove the firewall rule.

Execution Duration : Less than 15 seconds but will remove the firewall within an alloted time after the connection is no longer detected. (Note, you must know your internet IP address to enter into this command, not your local interface address). Note: Output only displayed in Admin Channel
 
            Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}access servername IPv4Address
            
           Example : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}access ddc2-dev 254.254.254.254
#############################################
{{/message.Help.Access}}{{#message.Help.Reboot}}
#############################################
           Command : Reboot
   
       Description : Reboot will restart the servers operating system. The server will respond during the DDC2 AutoStart (enabled by default) sequence on successful reboot event.

Execution Duration : It's Windows, could be 20 seconds, could be 30 minutes. Best to go get a cuppa tea and a few cookies.
 
             Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}reboot servername
            
            Example : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}reboot ddc2-dev
#############################################
{{/message.Help.Reboot}}{{#message.Help.Refresh}}
#############################################
           Command : Refresh
   
       Description : Refresh re-reads the ddc2 configuration files and loads the new configuration into Node-Red for use by the DDC2 flow. Great command for tweaking your server configuration without the need to re-deploy the Node-Red Flow.

Execution Duration : Approximately 3 seconds
 
            Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}refresh servername
            
           Example : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}refresh ddc2-dev
#############################################
{{/message.Help.Refresh}}{{#message.Help.Ports}}
#############################################
           Command : Ports
   
       Description : Ports displays all the server ports from DCS and supporting application configuration files.
       
              Note : Output only displayed in Admin Channel due to the sensitivity of the data provided.

Execution Duration : Instant, Cached Response
 
            Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}ports servername
            
           Example : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}ports ddc2-dev
#############################################
{{/message.Help.Ports}}{{#message.Help.Config}}
#############################################
           Command : Config
   
       Description : Config displays configuration settings in . 
 
Valid Applications : dcs  # DCS
                     srs  # SRS
                     lot  # LotATC
                     tac  # TacView
                     ddc2 # DDC2
 
              Note : Output only displayed in Admin Channel due to the sensitivity of the data provided.

Execution Duration : Instant, Cached Response
 
            Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}config servername application
            
         Example 1 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}config ddc2-dev -dcs
         Example 2 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}config ddc2-dev -lot
         Example 3 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}config ddc2-dev -tac
         Example 4 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}config ddc2-dev -ddc2
         Example 5 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}config ddc2-dev           #This will also display the DDC2 Configuration
#############################################
{{/message.Help.Config}}{{#message.Help.Version}}
#############################################
           Command : Version
   
       Description : Version displays the versions of DCS and supporting applications installed on the server. (Including DDC2)
       
Execution Duration : Instant, Cached Response
 
            Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}version servername
            
           Example : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}version ddc2-dev
#############################################
{{/message.Help.Version}}{{#message.Help.Info}}
#############################################
           Command : Info
   
       Description : Info displays connection information (including passwords). This command produces different output depending on where the command is executed. DDC2 settings also change the output of this command, they are listed below.
     DDC2 Settings : ShowLotATC         # Boolean to allow LotATC connection information to be displayed in non-Admin Channels
                     ShowTACView        # Boolean to allow TacView connection information to be displayed in non-Admin Channels    
                     ShowSrvPWD         # Boolean to allow Server Passwords to be displayed in non-Admin Channels (good setting for Private Servers managed publicly)
                     
 Channel Execution : Admin Channel      # Disregards DDC2 Settings and displays all connection information
                     Blue Force Channel # Considers DDC2 Settings and only displays Blue Force passwords                     
                     Red Force Channel  # Considers DDC2 Settings and only displays Red Force passwords
                     Support / Other    # Considers DDC2 Settings but does not display any Red or Blue passwords

Execution Duration : Instant, Cached Response
 
            Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}info servername
            
           Example : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}info ddc2-dev 
#############################################
{{/message.Help.Info}}{{#message.Help.Support}}
#############################################
           Command : Support
   
       Description : Support displays information on how, where and when to best contact the server support team. Message will change when request is used within the DDC2 designated support channel.
       
Execution Duration : Instant, Cached Response
 
            Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}support servername
            
           Example : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}support ddc2-dev
#############################################
{{/message.Help.Support}}{{#message.Help.Radio}}
#############################################
           Command : Radio
   
       Description : Radio command converts Discord text messages to Voice Radio messages on SRS. If no data other than the message is given it will use the server default settings.
 DDC2 SRS Defaults : Frequency  = {{{flow.DDC2.AppConfig.SRS.DDC2_FREQ}}}   # GLOBAL_LOBBY_FREQUENCIES setting in the SRS config file server.cfg
                     Freq High  = {{{flow.DDC2.AppConfig.SRS.DDC2_HIGH}}}  # Highest frequency supported by DDC2 Text to Radio
                     Freq Low   = {{{flow.DDC2.AppConfig.SRS.DDC2_LOW}}}   # Lowest frequency supported by DDC2 Text to Radio
                     Modulation = {{{flow.DDC2.AppConfig.SRS.DDC2_MOD}}}    # Hard set in DDC2 Settings, Currently only AM is supported, not changable at present
                     Volume     = {{{flow.DDC2.AppConfig.SRS.DDC2_VOL}}}    # Hard set in DDC2 Settings, not changable at present
                     Coalition  = {{{flow.DDC2.AppConfig.SRS.DDC2_COAL}}}    # Options are : 0 = Neutral / Spectators ; 1 = Red force ; 2 = Blue force

Execution Duration : Approximately 10 seconds depending on the length of your message.

            Useage : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}radio servername -freq frequency -coal coalition -msg "message"
        
         Example 1 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}radio servername -freq 122.5 -coal 1 -msg "This is a message for Red Force on 122.5 A M"
         Example 2 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}radio servername -msg "This is a message using the servers default frequency of {{{flow.DDC2.AppConfig.SRS.DDC2_FREQ}}} A M to the default coalition setting of {{{flow.DDC2.AppConfig.SRS.DDC2_COAL}}}"
         Example 3 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}radio servername -coal 2 -msg "This is a message using the servers default frequency of {{{flow.DDC2.AppConfig.SRS.DDC2_FREQ}}} A M to the Blue Forces"
         Example 4 : {{{flow.DDC2.ServerInfo.CommandPrefix}}}radio servername -freq -5000 -coal 2 -msg "This message will not transmit because the frequency is not between {{{flow.DDC2.AppConfig.SRS.DDC2_LOW}}} and {{{flow.DDC2.AppConfig.SRS.DDC2_HIGH}}} Mhz."
#############################################
{{/message.Help.Radio}}
```
